name: television production | television | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20841/documentation

This activity represents the production and disposal of an average colour LCD television device which is 25 inches diagonally and 30 kg in mass. It has the envisaged lifetime of 10 years and is manufactured in Japan / China. The figures on material inputs from technosphere are taken from Dodbiba et al. 2008. The figure on electricity required to manufacture a TV is taken from Feng and Ma 2009. Lastly, the figure on the annual production volume is taken from Samsung Global Newsroom 2017. 

The activity starts with the reception of materials at the factory

The activity includes the processes of material and energy use in manufacturing an average television. The inventory additionally accounts for disposal of all materials. Packaging is not included.
category: C:Manufacturing/26:Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products/264:Manufacture of consumer electronics/2640:Manufacture of consumer electronics

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Data for production are from 2008-2009 but represent the current technology.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Geography GLO was chosen because the dataset aims to represent the production of an average television. The literature sources used refer to manufacturing in China and Japan.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The literature sources used refer to manufacturing in China and Japan.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Recalculation of the data from Feng and Ma 2009 was made to bring the amount of electricity required to produce a TV set to the reference product (1 TV set). Energy values presented in MJ were subsequently converted into kWh assuming 1 kWh = 3.6 MJ.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Manufacturing data are taken from Dodbiba et al. 2008 and Feng and Ma 2009. Sources: Dodbiba, G., Takahashi, K., Sadaki, J., and Fujita, T., 2008. The recycling of plastic wastes from discarded TV sets: comparing energy recovery with mechanical recycling in the context of life cycle assessment. Journal of Cleaner Production, 16, 458-470. Feng, C., and Ma, X.Q., 2009. The energy consumption and environmental impacts of a color TV set in China. Journal of Cleaner Production, 17, 13-25. Data on the annual production volume are taken from a press-release of Samsung, a major TV set manufacturer. Source: Samsung Global Newsroom, 2017. This is QLED TV, part 2: winning the top 5%. Available from: https://news.samsung.com/global/this-is-qled-tv-part-2-winning-the-top-5 (Accessed 20 January 2018).

flow.name: television
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/26:Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products/264:Manufacture of consumer electronics/2640:Manufacture of consumer electronics

exchanges.description: Based on Dodbiba et al. 2008. The amount is set equal to the input amount for the respective material.

exchanges.description: Used here in place of infrastructure based on the amount of the largest contributor to the final product mass (glass). This is an estimated value. According to the general comment of the dataset 'Flat glass factory construction, GLO' [accessed 20.01.2018], the life time of the equipment is assumed to be 20 years and the annual production is 83000 t/a. Thus, the estimated lifetime output of the factory is 83000 x 20 = 1660000. As the television mass is 30 kg, then the number of televisions produced during the lifetime of the factory is 1660000 / 0.03 = 55333333 units. The calculation of the infrastructure is therefore 1/life time capacity = 1/55333333 unit.
